result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcello Javon Hernandez-Grant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence with credit of 4 days time served.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department. Maintain absolute sobriety.  No illegal drugs.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcello Javon Hernandez-Grant

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 1/21/16 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Defendant Marcello Javon Hernandez-Grant in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.  
Defendant ordered to serve 90 days in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit of 4 days time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  No illegal drugs.
*Obtain GED/HSED.
*Perform 30 hours of community service. 
*Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Marcello Javon Hernandez-Grant in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea/sentencing. Court granted defense's motion to adjourn.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marcello Javon Hernandez-Grant in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Defense requests a projected guilty plea date.  Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marcello Javon Hernandez-Grant in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requested more time. Court reminded the defendant to comply with all conditions of bail. Case adjourned to Branch 23. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marcello Javon Hernandez-Grant in court.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 23 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 08-18-15 at 01:30pm

02/13/2015
